content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    code_blocks = split(md, "```julia\n", keepempty=false)
    julia_code = map(block -> endswith(block, "\n") ? block[1:end-1] : block, code_blocks[2:end]))
    return join(julia_code, "\n")
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a markdown string `md` as input and returns a String containing all the Julia code blocks concatenated with newlines.

The function first splits the markdown string on the "```julia\n" delimiter to get an array of code blocks. It then filters out the non-Julia code blocks and removes the trailing newline character from each block (if present).

Finally, it joins all the processed code blocks together with a newline character between them and returns this concatenated String.
